intro: Hoya gigas, commonly known as the giant wax plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of star-shaped, waxy white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is known for its slow growth and ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Hoya gigas is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice among succulent and tropical plant enthusiasts.
